Detailed Description

This class implements parsing utilities for a CSV file.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plCSVLineParser::plCSVLineParser ( char  field_delimiter = ';',
char  line_delimiter = '\n',
const std::string &  undefined_field = "",
char  quote = '"' 
)
inlineexplicit

Constructs a CSV line parser.

Parameters
[in]field_delimiterthe field separator used in the CSV data. It's default value is ';' and it can be set later using set_field_delimiter().
[in]line_delimiterThe line separator used in the CSV data. It's default value is '
' and it can be set later using set_line_delimiter().
[in]undefined_fieldThe value that will correspond to an undefined field in the CSV data. Its default value is "" and it can be set later using set_undef_value_string(). In addition to this value, an empty field always corresponds to an undefined field.
[in]quoteThe character to be used for quoting text fields. The default is " and it can be set later using set_quote().

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T >
bool plCSVLineParser::read_from_current_line ( T &  item) const

Read an item from the current line.

Return false iff the item is not defined or the end of the line is reached.

This template method is instantiated for std::string, unsigned int, int, float, double, and long double types.

bool plCSVLineParser::read_line ( std::istream &  data_stream)

Read a new line from the input stream.

Return false iff the eof is reached.

bool plCSVLineParser::read_line_as_string_vector ( std::istream &  data_stream,
std::vector< std::string > &  string_vector 
)

Read a line and convert it to a vector of strings.

Return false iff the eof is reached.
